title: Distributed Cognitive Learning Design via Card Games: Social Problem-Solving Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of social phenomena and ability to learn game-based rules
context.additional_context: Collaborative Learning Design Leveraging the Impact of Spatial Card Game Arrangements on Cognitive and Communication Processes of Learners and Observers in VR Environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain social problem-solving strategies with 80% accuracy through visual arrangements of card games
Learners can analyze peers' problem-solving processes through observational learning and derive at least three cognitive strategies
Learners achieve over 70% success in solving complex social scenarios by collaborating with team members, applying distributed cognition principles
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
